linkLabel: Comparing Bases: Positano vs Sorrento vs Amalfi
intro: Compare the trade-offs between Positano, Sorrento, and Amalfi before choosing your base.

sections.title: Positano
body: Iconic scenery and staircases; ideal if you want to wake up in the postcard.
Transport needs more planning, so allow buffers around ferries and buses.

sections.title: Sorrento
body: Best rail and bus connections with a wide accommodation range.
Views are less dramatic than Positano, but value and convenience are strong.

sections.title: Amalfi
body: Ferry and bus hub with easy day trips to Ravello and nearby villages.
Expect mixed accommodation styles and plan around limited evening transport.

sections.title: Who each base suits
body: Positano for splurge views and hostel social life.
Sorrento for budget control and fast transit.
Amalfi for balanced access across the coast.

a: Stay in Positano if you want classic views, Sorrento for easy transport, and Amalfi for a middle ground with cathedral access.

faqs.q: Do I need a car if I stay outside Positano?
a: No. Ferries and buses link all three towns; a car adds parking stress unless you plan extensive inland excursions.
